Handling Policy Transactions After Issuance

Lesson
objectives

* Describe how BillingCenter invoices charges
for the following billing instruction types:
+ Policy change

+ Cancellation

+ Reinstatement

+ Renewal, New Renewal
+ Rewrite

¢ Describe how BillingCenter allocates the
credit from a negative charge

Setting the context Gi

Zhang \{s

Billing Clerk

This lesson discusses several BillingCenter
transactions, including policy change, cancellation,
reinstatement, renewal, and rewrite.

All these transactions involve at least one charge.
Each charge is sliced into one or more invoice items
at the start of the charge invoicing process.

Slicing a charge . G

¢ The appropriate method for dividing (“slicing”) a charge differs, Face
depending on the charge type a
¢ Typical charge slicing behaviors:

¢ Issuance, rewrite, renewal, and cancellation charges are sliced according to settings on the
payment plan

¢ Policy change charges are sliced to match the planned installments of an existing charge if
the charge can be matched with one or more charges already on the policy

+ If special handling is requested on a billing instruction, each charge is sliced into a single
invoice item

Handling negative and positive charges Gi

Suppose there is a mid-term policy change

Handling a negative charge is
similar to handling a positive one.
Let’s start by looking at policy
changes in general.

Policy change overview Gi

A policy change is a transaction that modifies a policy
Common reasons for policy changes are:
* Policyholder decides to add or remove coverages
* Policyholder decides to modify the scope of existing coverages
Policy change charges can be negative or positive
* Positive charges are typically for coverages added to a policy plus associated taxes and fees
+ Negative charges are usually the result of removing coverages from a policy
Policy change processing involves:
1. Slicing charges into invoice items and assigning them to invoices

2. Allocating negative invoice items to “pay” for unpaid positive invoice items

Policy reinstatement overview Gi

¢ Areinstatement is a transaction that makes a canceled policy effective again
¢ Apolicy is reinstated according to the charges in the reinstatement billing
instruction
* The policy’s charges are not automatically restored to their pre-cancellation state
¢ Reinstatement processing involves:

¢ Ifa reinstatement charge can be matched to one or more invoice item snapshots,
BillingCenter:

a) Uses snapshots to create invoices with bill dates and due dates ic
that match the pre-cancellation invoices I
b) Places reinstatement invoice items on appropriate invoices
* If BillingCenter cannot find a cancellation snapshot for the policy to be reinstated, it typically
slices each reinstatement charge using payment plan settings

Policy renewal overview Gi

A renewal is a transaction that creates a new policy period for an existing policy
+ Policy number stays the same with term number appended Policy #

Two renewal billing instructions: Renewal and New Renewal

HOOL-CMDJUNIOR2 q

¢ New Renewal indicates renewal of a legacy system policy that is unknown to BillingCenter
Renewal processing is similar to processing newly issued policies:

1. Renewal charges are categorized by charge pattern

2. Charges are sliced into invoice items according to the payment plan

3. Invoices are created and invoice items are assigned to invoices based on item placement
dates

You can override default renewal charge slicing by adding a payment plan override

« For example, no down payment for renewals/new renewals

Policy rewrite overview Gi

Arewrite is a transaction that creates a new policy from an existing policy
Common reasons for policy rewrites are:
* To correct a significant error that occurred during the initial submission of policy
* To put a canceled policy with a coverage gap back in force

A full-term rewrite replaces the entire term of the original policy

Amid-term rewrite replaces a portion of the original term of the original policy
Rewrite processing is similar to policy issuance and renewal processing:

1. Renewal charges are categorized by charge pattern

2. Charges are sliced into invoice items according to the payment plan

3. Invoices are created; invoice items are assigned to invoices based on item placement dates

You can override default rewrite charae slicing hv adding 3a navment nlan override
